title: Serving with Love and Humility
sub_title: The Joy of a Servant's Heart
devotional:
Old Man Hemlock, they called him. Not to his face, of course. He wasn't mean, just…particular. Hemlock kept the church gardens immaculate. Every weed pulled, every rose pruned, every blade of grass trimmed to perfection. He worked tirelessly, day in, day out. Some whispered he did it for the praise, others said it was an obsession. But few understood the quiet joy it gave him.

One sweltering summer day, a group of teenagers, begrudgingly volunteering for community service, were assigned to Hemlock. They grumbled, they complained, they half-heartedly tugged at weeds, more interested in their phones than the task at hand. Hemlock watched them, his face unreadable.

Finally, one young man, tired of the charade, threw down his trowel. "Why do you even bother? It's just a garden. No one even notices!" he exclaimed.

Hemlock, without a word, picked up the trowel and carefully weeded around a delicate rose bush. He then looked at the young man, his eyes filled with a surprising gentleness. "It's not about the notice, son," he said softly. "It's about the service. It's about doing something beautiful, something good, for the love of it. It's about offering your time and your effort as a gift. And whether anyone sees it or not, God sees it. And that's all that matters."

The young man, and the others, were silent. They looked at Hemlock, at the meticulously cared-for garden, and at the quiet dedication etched on his face. They began to work, slowly at first, but with a newfound sense of purpose. They began to serve.

That evening, as the sun set, the teenagers left, tired but strangely satisfied. Hemlock, alone in the garden, smiled. He hadn't sought praise or recognition. He had simply served. And in that service, he had found a profound sense of peace and fulfillment. The garden wasn't just a garden; it was an offering, a testament to his love for God and his desire to serve Him with all his heart.
image_description: A meticulously maintained rose garden with vibrant blooms and neatly trimmed hedges, bathed in the warm light of the setting sun. No people present.
insights: Jesus often emphasized the importance of selfless service. In Matthew 20:28, He says, '...the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.' This verse encapsulates the essence of Christian service: it's not about seeking personal gain or recognition, but about offering oneself for the benefit of others. Furthermore, 1 Peter 4:10 reminds us, 'Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God’s grace in its various forms.' This underscores that everyone has something to offer and that our service is a reflection of God's grace.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to cultivate a servant's heart. Show me the opportunities to serve those around me, both in big and small ways. Remove any selfish motives from my actions and help me to serve with humility, love, and joy, knowing that my service is ultimately an offering to You. Amen.
reflection: Think about a time you served someone without expecting anything in return. How did it make you feel? What are some practical ways you can serve others in your community, your church, or your family this week? How can you shift your mindset from seeking recognition to finding joy in simply serving?
